Robin Trust Nursing School Programs

Robin Trust Nursing School is a private nursing education institution located in Cape Town, South Africa. The school was established in 2007 and offers a range of nursing programs.

Some of the programs offered by Robin Trust Nursing School include:

Enrolled Nursing Auxiliary (ENA) program: This program provides students with the skills and knowledge necessary to work as an Enrolled Nursing Auxiliary.

Bridging course for Enrolled Nurses: This program is designed for Enrolled Nurses who wish to upgrade their qualification to become Registered Nurses.

Bachelor of Nursing Science program: This is a four-year program that prepares students for a career as a Registered Nurse.

Postgraduate programs: Robin Trust Nursing School offers postgraduate programs in nursing, including a Postgraduate Diploma in Nursing Education and a Master of Nursing Science program.

The school is accredited by the Council on Higher Education (CHE) and registered with the South African Nursing Council (SANC).

What to Know About the Robin Trust Nursing School Application Form Portal

The Robin Trust Nursing School RTNS Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission list, etc.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission in the RTNS application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to RTNS on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

Robin Trust Nursing School Application Requirements

The application requirements for Robin Trust Nursing School may vary depending on the program you are applying for. However, here are some general application requirements that may apply:

Completed application form:

You will need to complete the relevant application form for the program you are interested in.

Academic transcripts:

You will need to provide certified copies of your academic transcripts or certificates, depending on the program requirements.

Identity document:

You will need to provide a certified copy of your identity document or passport.

Application fee:

You may need to pay an application fee when submitting your application.

English proficiency:

If English is not your first language, you may need to provide proof of English proficiency, such as a TOEFL or IELTS score.

Health and immunization requirements:

You may be required to provide proof of certain health and immunization requirements before starting your program.

Criminal record check:

Depending on the program, you may be required to provide a criminal record check or police clearance certificate.

How to Apply | Robin Trust Nursing School

  1. Go to the Robin Trust Nursing School website at https://www.robintrust.org.za/.
  2. Click on the “Apply Now” button located in the top right-hand corner of the page.
  3. You will be directed to the online application portal.
  4. If you are a new user, you will need to create an account by providing your email address and creating a password. If you already have an account, you can log in using your email address and password.
  5. Once you have logged in, you can select the program you wish to apply for and complete the online application form.
  6. Make sure to upload all the required documents and pay the application fee (if applicable).
  7. Submit your application online.

If you encounter any difficulties with the online application process, you can contact the admissions office at Robin Trust Nursing School for assistance.

 

Robin Trust Nursing School Application Required Documents

To apply to RTNS you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript
